body_html:
The TensorFlow Mobile API only supports "frozen graphs" (where all model parameters are "frozen" as constants in the graph) and not the SavedModel format at this time.

See https://www.tensorflow.org/mobile/prepare_models for details on creating frozen models suitable for TensorFlow mobile. I believe changes are in progress to make it easier to created frozen models as well as models in a format usable by TFLite directly from the SavedModel format.

Hope that helps.
body_text:
The TensorFlow Mobile API only supports "frozen graphs" (where all model parameters are "frozen" as constants in the graph) and not the SavedModel format at this time.
See https://www.tensorflow.org/mobile/prepare_models for details on creating frozen models suitable for TensorFlow mobile. I believe changes are in progress to make it easier to created frozen models as well as models in a format usable by TFLite directly from the SavedModel format.
Hope that helps.
body:
The TensorFlow Mobile API only supports "frozen graphs" (where all model parameters are "frozen" as constants in the graph) and not the [SavedModel](https://www.tensorflow.org/programmers_guide/saved_model#build_and_load_a_savedmodel) format at this time.

See https://www.tensorflow.org/mobile/prepare_models for details on creating frozen models suitable for TensorFlow mobile. I believe changes are in progress to make it easier to created frozen models as well as models in a format usable by [TFLite](https://www.tensorflow.org/mobile/) directly from the SavedModel format.

Hope that helps.
